alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:39AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chase, northeastern Butler and Greenwood Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 138 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles south of Cottonwood Falls, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, brief heavy rain, frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Cottonwood Falls, Madison, Hamilton, Cassoday, Bazaar, Climax, Virgil, Matfield Green, Eureka City Lake, Thrall, Eureka Airport, Wonsevu and Saffordville. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 88 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for east central Kansas.
